page.title: 05"Bowcombe"-Rowborough Farm.
page.content: {Rowborough}is one of two farms held by the present owner, the other being{ {Idlecombe Farm;}inhabited and managed by his son. The two farms together comprise about 500 acres and, like the other farms in the area, combine in roughly equal proportions arable farming and cattle farming. Pigs are also kept, and the owner has a small herd of French Charolais cattle of which he is very proud. Like the family who farm Cheverton; the family who farm Rowborough and Idlecombe have many local relatives, some of whom also farm. As with other farms in the area; the nature of the land poses certain problems: Its hilly terrain can cause difficulty, and the acidity of the soil calls for regular dressing with chalk; of which there is fortunately an abundance in the area.
